image.altText: A white and red passenger ship moored in a bay in an industrial area.

props.synopsis: The Tasmanian premier has refused to rule out the state's newly built Spirit of Tasmania ferry being used to house Ukrainian refugees in Scotland.

title.children: Government not ruling out Ukraine refugees on new Spirit of Tasmania ferry

image.altText: Wind farm turbines

props.synopsis: A proposal to build a wind farm on a remote island off Tasmania's north-west coast is a step closer to realisation, despite environmentalists decrying its possible impact on a critically endangered bird species.

title.children: Wind farm a step closer after Supreme Court appeal dismissed

image.altText: close up of ceramic fragment found on Bruny Island. Shows person in uniform wearing hat.

props.synopsis: When Amanda Richardson stumbled upon a seemingly old pottery fragment near a walking track on Bruny Island in Tasmania, its history caused huge speculation online.

title.children: 'Little face' ceramic fragment found on island sparks online debate

image.altText: Man speaking in front of microphones to a group of people

props.synopsis: Cabinet approved the use of public funds for then-Tasmanian cabinet minister Michael Ferguson's personal defamation action against an individual in 2020. Right-to-information documents show it came to $300,000.

title.children: Tasmanians billed $300,000 for Michael Ferguson's legal fees, RTI shows

image.altText: Grove bus stop 2025-02-25 11:02:00

props.synopsis: Locals warn they've seen "many near misses" between schoolkids and cars at a notorious bus stop along Tasmania's Huon Highway that was the site of an accident this week.

title.children: 'It's ridiculous': Boy critically injured at highway bus stop known for 'near misses'

image.altText: An unidentified doctor holds a pile of red, yellow and white complementary medicine pills in their outstretched hands.

props.synopsis: Almost 10 years after being directed to regulate unregistered health practitioners to better protect the public, some parts of Australia still haven't got around to it.

title.children: Calls for greater regulation as people running 'wellness centres out of their living room'

image.altText: A woman with dark shoulder-length hair wears a pink checkered shirt, sitting on a couch in glowy window light.

props.synopsis: Australia's housing industry and regulators aren't keeping up with the desire to build smaller, denser housing in cities around the country, including regional centres, experts say.

title.children: Australia is in the middle of a culture shift to smaller homes, experts say

image.altText: Anthony Albanese sings with a Matilda scarf around his neck

props.synopsis: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese adds his condemnation to Marty Sheargold following his comments about the Matildas, while former athletes Libby Trickett, Melissa Barbieri and Kate McShea also speak out.

title.children: 'Shocking', 'unacceptable' and 'offensive': Albanese slams Sheargold

image.altText: A woman sits on a bench looking out to sea.

props.synopsis: Her fake psychologist was found out, fired and three months later, did it all again.

title.children: Melbourne woman convicted for holding fake 'psychology sessions'

image.altText: Elon Musk opens a black jacket to reveal a t-shirt that says "tech support".

props.synopsis: Elon Musk makes a star appearance at Donald Trump's first cabinet meeting, winning praise from the president for his controversial work as cost-cutting czar.

title.children: Musk's 'tech support' and other moments at Trump's first cabinet meeting

image.altText: Journalist Antoinette Lattouf walks toward a court.

props.synopsis: The Federal Court case over the alleged unlawful termination of Antoinette Lattouf is nearing its conclusion, with the presenter's legal team delivering their closing arguments today. Take a look back at our live blog.

title.children: Court urged to find race as a reason for Lattouf being taken off air — as it happened

image.altText: Toyah Cordingley sits with her dogs.

props.synopsis: A court has heard a man linked to Toyah Cordingley initially lied to police about the nature of their relationship.

title.children: Man testifies he lied to police about extent of relationship with Toyah Cordingley

image.altText: An older gentleman with grey facial hair and a blue collared shirt stands in a kitchen with a serious expression.

props.synopsis: What are the key issues on your mind this federal election? We want to know.

title.children: 'Struggling to breathe': Cost of living top of mind for voters as federal election looms

image.altText: A man wearing a light pink collared business shirt and blue suit jacket gestures with his right hand while persenting.

props.synopsis: Software giant WiseTech is in turmoil after a series of allegations were made against its founder. Here's what the scandal is about, and why it's costing the publicly-listed company billions of dollars in market value.

title.children: Richard White has lost billions as WiseTech's share price has collapsed

image.altText: A man wearing a face mask sits next to an iPhone 16 advertisement

props.synopsis: It's one of the largest companies in the world. That didn't stop the Indonesian government from banning Apple's iPhone 16 and gaining enormous investment pledges.

title.children: Indonesia made iPhones a forbidden fruit — and triumphed over Apple

props.synopsis: Around the clock coverage of news events as they break at home and abroad.

title.children: ABC News Channel live

image.altText: A small cart exits a large tunnel in the an alpine national park

props.synopsis: Underground work has stopped on the Snowy 2.0 project and a safety review is underway after a ventilation fan imploded at the site earlier this week.

title.children: 'Miracle' no-one hurt as Snowy 2.0 fan implosion sends metal flying

image.altText: A photo of a Qatar Airways plane taking off.

props.synopsis: Treasurer Jim Chalmers approves Qatar's 25 per cent stake in Virgin with strict conditions, while tech giant Nvidia reports strong fourth-quarter results. Follow live.

title.children: Nvidia posts strong results, treasurer approves Qatar-Virgin deal, ASX opens higher

image.altText: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy listens during a news conference.

props.synopsis: Busy Ukrainian officials are working tirelessly to secure a lasting peace deal and end the war with Russia, but not all agree on the latest approach from the US and Donald Trump.

title.children: Ukraine's war room fears a ceasefire could be a 'Russian trap'

image.altText: A boy warms up around a bonfire in the Gaza Strip

props.synopsis: Night-time temperatures in Gaza, where hundreds of thousands of people have been displaced and are living in tents following more than a year of intense Israeli attacks, have dipped below 9 degrees Celsius over the past two weeks.

title.children: Newborn babies die amid Gaza cold snap, civil defence agency says

image.altText: A football drops into the goal over jumping Matildas goalkeeper Teagan Micah.

props.synopsis: A wildly deflected goal by Colombia cancels out Hayley Raso's second-half equaliser as the Matildas fall to a third straight loss at the SheBelieves Cup in the United States.

title.children: Matildas coach says 'frailties' were on show in third straight loss

image.altText: Ezra Mam looks on during a training session

props.synopsis: Ezra Mam is focused on being someone future generations can look up to after surviving the prospect of his contract being torn up by the Broncos as a result of his car crash.

title.children: Ezra Mam determined to become a 'positive role model' after car crash

image.altText: A close-up of Trachtenberg with her dark hair in loose waves and wearing heavy eyeliner

props.synopsis: The New York Medical Examiner is investigating the death of actor Michelle Trachtenberg, who was found unresponsive in her Manhattan apartment.

title.children: What we know about Michelle Trachtenberg's death

image.altText: Suburban Power lines

props.synopsis: A man who worked for the Northern Territory's electricity distributor has been sentenced for interfering with his home meter using magnets for more than 20 years, in a ploy to save money on power bills.

title.children: Electricity worker used magnets to tamper with home meter for 20 years

image.altText: a  torpedo on a beach

props.synopsis: Police say an object found washed up on Main Beach is a "practice" torpedo that went missing during a recent Defence training drill off the Queensland Coast.

title.children: Device found on Gold Coast beach a torpedo missing since ADF drill

image.altText: Hens on a farm beneath a sunny sky.

props.synopsis: Bird flu continues to spread in Australia while the rest of the world grapples with the disease's most virulent strain.

title.children: Australia loses 10 per cent of laying hens to bird flu

image.altText: Signage of the shire as entering town.

props.synopsis: Five councillors from the Shire of Derby-West Kimberley have stepped down from council leaving the remote local government in a difficult position.

title.children: Derby councillors in mass resignation, paralysing decision-making

image.altText: close up image of woman recording herself on a smartphone

props.synopsis: Sex worker Kayla Jade, sexologist Juliet Allen and podcaster Abbie Chatfield are just some local influencers, or sexfluencers, sharing their knowledge and experience.

title.children: Sexfluencers are 'democratising sex', but how reliable is their content?

image.altText: Aerial view of some houses and a field

props.synopsis: Looking to lower your insurance premiums? Here's what the experts think about the strategies ABC readers used to get ahead.

title.children: How our readers lowered their home insurance premiums

image.altText: A woman with blonde wavy hair wearing pendant diamond earrings, a necklace and a one-shouldered white gown

props.synopsis: A memoir, a documentary, a Broadway debut and now her first lead role in a feature film in three decades: welcome to the 'Pam-aissance'.

title.children: ​​'No-one could play this role but me': Pamela Anderson in The Last Showgirl

image.altText: A map of Melbourne

props.synopsis: The state government has named an additional 25 locations across metropolitan Melbourne where it wants to change planning rules to fast-track housing development.

title.children: Victorian government unveils full plan for high-rise development zones

image.altText: A seaplane lying upside down under water on the sea floor after crashing off Rottnest Island.

props.synopsis: An ATSB report details how text messages between the pilot involved in a fatal seaplane crash and his boss indicated concerns over strong winds on the day of the incident off Western Australia's Rottnest Island.

title.children: Text messages reveal wind fears in lead-up to fatal Rottnest plane crash

image.altText: Young smiling girl, braces wears blue tee with surf culture australia written, holds surfboard, house, white sand in background.

props.synopsis: Home Education Association says the number of people choosing to homeschool their children is growing. However, an academic warns it may not be for everyone.

title.children: Lily loves going surfing. It's all part of her formal schooling

image.altText: Three concerned-looking women look in the direction of the camera.

props.synopsis: Set amid the Woman, Life, Freedom uprisings in Iran — following the death in custody of Mahsa Amini — The Seed of the Sacred Fig shows a family unravelling just like their country.

title.children: Cast and creators of Iranian film banned from leaving the country

image.altText: A mother and daughter sit together on a bed using a tablet.

props.synopsis: As schools ask parents to read hundreds of thousands of words to consent to technology usage in classrooms, who's protecting their children's data?

title.children: Kim was asked to approve her daughter's use of classroom apps — by reading 200,000 words
